Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2012 07:58AM June56 wrote: I was very sore last night. I slept in a recliner. It made my but hurt! : ) We folded a towel lengthwise and put it under me so my husband could steady me as I stood up. It really helped as I could not use my arms and my legs were a bit weak. I am getting up on my own now. Don't forget a laxative. The pain meds could constipated you.the tissue expander has not bothered me. The reduction from a DD to a C is sore still. Take the pain meds! Don't let the pain get away from you and you will be able to push through it. I am going to sit in my resin chair today and wipe off. I will keep you girls updated each day so you will know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2012 03:28PM June56 wrote: Fruit of the Loom makes a soft front closure bra. It may not be the greatest for the well endowed, but for average gals it should work. It is at walmart.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2012 07:44AM June56 wrote: Oh, Mumtothree! Big, big hug! You are dealing with a ton of stuff. When I am overwhelmed with things, I take one at a time and see if I can resolve it in any way. Sometimes I can and sometimes I have to turn it over to God. Praying makes things much easier for me. About the hair loss. I had a friend with the same thing. She was married, but her husband had a heart attack and died. Happily, a year and a half later she remarried. She lost her hair at age 13 and has lived her entire adult life without it. Are you considering reconstruction? That might be an option. The foobs I have seen look better than my old ones! I had large breasts and had the PS take my one down 4 cup sizes. Less fills on the other side and smaller shirts! Yeah! Please keep posting here and we will do our best to be your support system. Try to enjoy your day. I am sitting on top of a mountain in a cloud right now. Hope to see the sun soon. Peace.

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2012 10:37AM June56 wrote: Hey everybody! I am one of the July girls checking in on you! August is here and it will be a month of transitions. Good, positive ones. I am two weeks out from my unimx and feel good. I took the pain meds for a week and then went to Advil. It has worked great for me. Blessings20 had a great post with lots of great tips. I wanted to list the things I got prior to surgery that I really used. List as follows: recliner, satin boxers(helps to slide and not overuse your arms),no bra cami tops one size bigger, a pair of pull on pants and shorts, ribbon or lace to pin the drains to if you are allowed to shower,a table by the recliner with all the things that will keep you company( iPad, kindle, etc.),bottle of water at all times(your throat will get fuzzy and it will clear up a coughing spell), jolly ranchers or other hard candy,and last but not least...white, cotton grandpa undershirts(so comforting to sleep in with your silky boxers. If you have any questions, please let me know. I would love to help if I can. One more thing, get help washing your hair. I have been going to my sweet stylist who has been wonderful! Know we are thinking about you and will be waiting in the other side. June
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 04:51PM June56 wrote: Monday girls: will be waiting for you on the other side! Carrie: I am one of the July girls. It is a crazy ride we are on! I was dx the end of April. Told over and over that it was less than 1 cm and lumpectomy would take are of it. So, off we went for lumpie number 1. The margins came back dirty. Six weeks later we were back for number 2. Still had dirty margins and the DCIS was more like 6cm+. I was a DD cup and the lumpies had changed the shape of my breast. At this point, I was done and ready for mx. I had the worry LD in the back of my mind as I have it in my ankles due to sports injuries. I only had SNB, but I am going to be very careful with that arm. I had a major reduction on my opposite breast as my insurance would not cover a bmx. I wanted to get rid of as much breast tissue that could get cancer as I could. I went from a large DD to a B. I have TE in the rt breast and it does look like an A cup. The swelling has gone down a lot. I am a little lopsided, but unless you really look, you couldn't tell. I wish you the best. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 01:10PM June56 wrote: Carrie: It was not a big deal for me to have a second lumpectomy. I didn't have any problems or pain with them. I would talk with my BS and get that opinion. Don't want to be going forward looking backward. I try to live without regret. The TE doesn't bother me. They feel like a water balloon under the skin. I go for my first fill next week, so I may have a different opinion then!

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 09:27PM June56 wrote: Just: such a pretty bracelet and so thoughtful. Blessings: no one talked to me about drain care. I will have had them three weeks on Wed and I am still putting out 50 cc a day. I was supposed to get it out tomorrow, but I guess not. Had a nice crying jag tonight. Not usual for me, but this healing is going so slow. Sitting around is just not anything I have ever been good at. Hope everyone gets great rest tonight. Market, Robin, Pinky and Pointvalue. Thinking of you. Hugsssss.
